jhelp.gui.samples.game

Class SnakeFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • jhelp.gui.JHelpFrame
                • jhelp.gui.JHelpFrameImage
                  • jhelp.gui.game.JHelpGame2D
                    • jhelp.gui.samples.game.SnakeFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, EventManager

    public class SnakeFrame
extends JHelpGame2D
implements EventManager
    The snake frame.
    By default arrow for control Snake, E for exit, W for menu and change key mapping
    Author:
    JHelp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • actionState

        public boolean actionState(java.util.Map<ActionKey,java.lang.Boolean> actionsStates,
                  int mouseX,
                  int mouseY,
                  boolean buttonLeft,
                  boolean buttonMiddle,
                  boolean buttonRight)
        Called to do action on action key

        Parent documentation:
        Actual action key and mouse state
        Specified by:
        actionState in interface EventManager
        Parameters:
        actionsStates - Action key current states (Several key may be down in same time)
        mouseX - Mouse X position
        mouseY - Mouse Y position
        buttonLeft - Indicates if mouse left button is down
        buttonMiddle - Indicates if mouse middle button is down
        buttonRight - Indicates if mouse right button is down
        Returns:
        true beacause whe consume keys
        See Also:
        EventManager.actionState(java.util.Map, int, int, boolean, boolean, boolean)
